intro: Calycobolus lanulosus, commonly known as the woolly calycobolus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, woolly foliage and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. It typically grows in wetland habitats and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
